intro: Pedicularis versicolor var. sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers that range from yellow to red, often with a distinctive bilabiate structure. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
